headline: Us Reopen Canada Mexico Land Borders November
summary: The U.S. has announced that it will lift land border restrictions with Mexico and Canada in November for fully vaccinated people.  Since March 2020, restrictions have been placed on non-essential travelers to combat the COVID-19 pandemic.The new rules will be rolled out starting in early November for non-essential, fully vaccinated visitors who wish to see family or come as tourists. In January, the vaccination requirement will apply to all inbound foreign travelers, whatever their reason for travel. These moves follow the announcement in September that the U.S. wouldend country-based travel bans for air travel, and seek vaccination proof from foreign nationals instead.
